1. Cut off any exess fat
2.Score brisket 1/2" in cross hatch pattern Rub thoroughly with dry rub
3. Place in 4" hotel pan with 1 L water (maybe stock?) Top with parchment and seal with tin foil
4. Place in alto sham at 300 F 5. Cook for 14 hours or until tender 6. Rest for 30 minutes in the liquid to let cool enough to handle with glovesa 7. Pull the brisket apart in long shreds 8. reserve liquid for maming sauce 9. cool finished prepertion, label it and store it, rotated this item with older product correctly and diligently

Method:
Cut eggplants in half lengthwise. Place on baking sheet face down and cook in oven on high heat. When thoroughly cooked set aside to cool. When still warm and able to picked up, scoop out the flesh from the eggplant and place in robocoupe. Puree till smooth and add minced garlic and remaining ingredients.

Method:

3. Put tomatoes into an insert and add red onion, jalapeno, cilantro, kosher salt, black pepper and lime juice. Mix well using hands with gloves on.
3. Adjust seasoning To taste.

1) In saute pan over medium heat, toast peppercorns and fennel until fragrant. Allow to cool and grind in spice grinder. Add chili flakes and reserve.
2) Combine parsley, cilantro, garlic cloves, canola oil, lemon juice and cumin. Blitz into a paste with robot coupe. Reserve.
3) Combine herb paste with fennel, peppercorns and chili flakes and S&P.
4) Reserve for porchetta.
* An 265G. recipe will make enough for 2 (two) porchetta.
Allergens: No known priority allergens. -cool, store, label and rotated this item with older product correctly and diligently

Johnny,
Related Products this prep gets used in:
Allergens: (to be filled out by nutrition) Method:
1) With pork belly skin side down, rub belly with Porchetta Rub generously.
2) Roll belly into a tight log. You may need a buddy to help you hold the belly in place. Tie butchers knots on each end of porchetta than one good tie in the middle to secure. Continue making butchers knots 1" apart until fully tied.
3) Combine kosher salt and baking powder. Rub over skin of porchetta.
4) Store in fridge, uncovered for at least 24 hours, or up to 3 days.
5) Preheat oven to 300*F. Place porchetta seam side down on cooling rack inside of roasting rack. Roast until internal temperature of 60*C (140*F) is reached.
6) Increase oven temperature to 500*F and roast for 20-30 minutes until skin is blistered and very crispy.
7) Rest for 15 minutes and serve.

Method:
1. Gather All Ingredients and tools 2. Set up robot coupe slicer for 1/8" slicing. If you don't know how to set it up, ask Chef or a 1st Cook. 3. Chop the ends off of jalapenos and place in compost bin. Do not remove seeds. Set up 4" full hotel pan under the chute to catch the sliced jalapenos. 4. On the slowest speed, carfully drop peppers into the feed chute. Do not mash a whole bunch in there, or else the cuts won't come out even. 5. Repeat until production is done for the day. Label, date, refrigerate, or hold cold for service.

Utensils needed:

1) Remove all leaves from thick stem.
2) Stack and line stem to tip, up 10-20 leaves largest at the bottom, smallest on top. Roll the stack in to a tight a tube as possible. Starting at the tip of the tube, holding stem, cut super thin ribbons of leaf.
3) Final product should be thin strips that can be used for garnish. Cut only what you need for the day, as they do not last very long.
